intro: Senecio meridanus, commonly known as the Mountain Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio meridanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
